com.mishmash.rally
Class HandEvaluator

java.lang.Object
  com.mishmash.rally.HandEvaluator

public class HandEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object

This is the all-knowing, all-powerful evaluation class of CardMinnow. Allowing a wild card and hands that can be as large as a whole deck introduces more difficulty to picking out a five card hand and requires more read-throughs of the cards. Sorting saves us some work and allows some optimization.

Author:
mrmcduff

Constructor Detail

public HandEvaluator()
Method Detail

evaluate

public void evaluate(Hand hand)
Method to evaluate a hand. This is the 'master' method of this class. Checks each of the possible hand types to see what the input hand contains and picks the best. It sets its data in the input hand.

Parameters:
hand - The hand to be evaluated. We evaluate by using hand.setType().

sortHand

public HandEvaluator.SimplifiedHand sortHand(Hand hand)
Sorts through all the cards of a hand to make it much easier and faster to determine its value.

Parameters:
hand - The 'unfiltered' hand to be sorted.
Returns:
The SimplifiedHand struct storing the Hand's data in a more convenient way.

getBestCollection

public HandEvaluator.FiveCardHand getBestCollection(HandEvaluator.SimplifiedHand simpleHand)
Gets the best 'collection' hand available. Collection hands are those made up of n-tuples, so pair, two pair, three of a kind, full house, four of a kind, and five of a kind. High card falls into this category by default.

Parameters:
simpleHand - The SimplifiedHand to be checked.
Returns:
A FiveCardHand with the best possible collection.

getBestStraight

public HandEvaluator.FiveCardHand getBestStraight(HandEvaluator.SimplifiedHand simpleHand)
Gets the best available straight from the given SimplifiedHand.

Parameters:
simpleHand - The simplified hand to search
Returns:
A FiveCardHand struct-class with the best straight hand, or HIGH_CARD if there is no straight.

getBestFlush

public HandEvaluator.FiveCardHand getBestFlush(HandEvaluator.SimplifiedHand simpleHand)
Gets the best flush from a simplified hand, not taking into account whether or not the flush is a straight flush. This sorts by highest card (or highest first two cards, or first three cards, and so on) in the flush set.

Parameters:
simpleHand - The SimplifiedHand to search.
Returns:
A FiveCardHand representing the best flush, or a HIGH_CARD hand if there is no flush.

getBestStraightFlush

public HandEvaluator.FiveCardHand getBestStraightFlush(HandEvaluator.SimplifiedHand simpleHand)
Gets the best straight flush from the input SimplifiedHand.

Parameters:
simpleHand - The SimplifiedHand to search for a straight flush.
Returns:
The highest ranking straight flus in the input hand, or a HIGH_CARD hand if no straight flush exists.
